The transformation of Aṅgulimāla [mn86:1: I used to be a bandit, the notorious Aṅgulimāla.
I used to have blood on my hands, the notorious Aṅgulimāla.
See the refuge I’ve found— the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.
The result of deeds (a repetitive senten: I’ve done many of the sort of deeds that lead to a bad destination.
The result of my deeds has already struck me, so I enjoy my food free of debt.
Diligence and happiness (a causal sequen: Fools and half-wits devote themselves to negligence.
But the wise protect diligence as their best treasure.
Don’t devote yourself to negligence, or delight in sexual intimacy.
For if you’re diligent and practice absorption, you’ll attain abundant happiness.
The advice received (a causal chain) [mn: It was welcome, not unwelcome, the advice I got was good.
Of teachings that are shared, I encountered the best.
It was welcome, not unwelcome, the advice I got was good.
I’ve attained the three knowledges and fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.
